--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> I never thought I would have to do this, but I have to regretfully 
leave
> this rpg. I barely have any time left to myself anymore, and am 
having
> problems awnsering all the e-mail, espeacially as a council member 
(LN,
> you make our life very rough). Reading through 80 ooc's a day about
> nothing important is getting very tirring as well. I want to say 
though,
> it's been one hell of a ride, I had a lot of fun, and I hope you 
guys
> can keep it going, and improve it. Just remember to try and be nice 
to
> new people who join.
> 
> I'd like to give speacial thank you's to:
> 
> Soulstice: For befriending me so easily, and always being around to 
talk
> to, for anything from the rpg to wrestling. I'll miss you budy.
> 
> Kslawdogg: For being the first person to approach me when I joined, 
and
> help me understand the game, and then for being a good friend for so
> long throughout it.
> 
> Alloran: I know he probably won't get this, but I'd like to thank 
him
> for supporting me, and also being so friendly when I first joined.
> 
> Airly: For also being a true friend. I also have a lot of respect 
for
> you airly, trying to learn how to play a game like this in a second
> language. I know how hard it can be to learn another language.
> 
> Yanshosh: I know he may not be able to read it either, but he best
> represents this rpg. He was an awesome story teller, and I have my 
best
> fights with him, as he was always fair, and that made it fun.
> 
> Also thanks to everyone who voted for me back at the election, I
> appreaciated the show of support I received. Again, I had a blast, 
and I
> am sorry I can't tie up all my characters, but this letter took me 
three
> days to get to. Have fun guys.
> 
> PS: How do I get the rpg to stop sending me mail?
